p: The oil and emulsifier, at a mass ratio of 2:3, were mixed at 37°C, then, 0.2 mL of the mixture was added dropwise into 20 mL of deionized water with stirring at 100 r.min -1 at 37°C.The performance of the formulations was visually assessed by the following grading system[ 19]: (A) Microemulsion which was clear or slightly bluish in appearance. (B) Slightly less clear emulsion which had a bluish white appearance. (C) A bright white emulsion. (D) A dull, greyish white emulsion with a slightly oily appearance. (E) A formulation which exhibited either poor or minimal emulsification with large oil droplets present on the surface. Based on the above conditions, suitable oils, emulsifiers and co-emulsifiers were preliminary screened.
